DOC.brief_title: Effectiveness Medical Taping Concept Primary Dysmenorrhea
DOC.detailed_description: The aim study ass analgesic efficacy self-applied Medical Taping Concept treatment primary dysmenorrhea . To evaluate effect , total 128 student University Miguel Hernández , follow inclusion criterion , participate study : history menstrual pain , age 18 39 year perform gynecological check last 18 month diagnose kind primary dysmenorrhea . A preliminary survey identify valid student make . Thereafter participant separate two different group ( intervention group placebo group ) order request completion three questionnaire characteristics menstrual pain demographic data next two menstrual cycle intervention . One survey include graphic scale student could mark start end symptom associate menstrual cycle . After principal researcher interview participant show correct auto-application menstrual bandage placebo . Each student group receive triptych information picture correct application adhesive strip . Finally , two new menstrual cycle , participant answer questionnaire assess symptoms menstrual pain worn adhesive strip ( 3 piece Kinesio tape - 20 cm x 5 cm Tape Cure ®- , apply abdominal low back , intervention group ; 2 piece Cross Tape ® 2.5 cm x 2 cm - , hip joint , placebo group . Participants may personal hygiene day menstrual cycle adhesives strip place oneself . The size sample 128 girl . Differences contrast comparison mean ( quantitative improvement , ANOVA ) evaluate intervention . 18 girl randomly choose obtain estimation contrast parameter consider ( mean standard variation ) . With size sample significance 5 % , investigator power total sample contrast 80 % . To describe variable , investigator use frequency ( absolute relative ) qualitative variable . For quantitative variable , investigator use mean plus standard variation . To verify homogeneity randomization investigator use test base X2 ( Pearson Fisher ) t-test . The procedure use verify participant quit study similar characteristic remain . The improvement analyze quantitatively use ANOVA test . Dependent variable : pain intervention . Independent variable : pain intervention , change pharmacological therapy intervention group . In event significant difference ANOVA model investigator use Tukey post-hoc test , order determine difference exist two group . Qualitatively , investigator assess improvement calculate indicator clinical relevance : relative risk ( RR ) , absolute risk reduction ( ARR ) , relative risk reduction ( RRR ) , number need treat ( NNT ) . All analysis make significance 5 % . The confidence interval ( CI ) calculate relevant parameter . The analysis do use IBM SPSS Statistics 19.0 .
DOC.criteria: Women present menstrual pain grade 23 accord classification severity primary dysmenorrhea Andersch Milsom . Have attend gynecological examination past 18 month ever diagnose gynecological disorder different primary dysmenorrhea Not diagnose secondary dysmenorrhea Regular menstrual cycle ( cycle typical range 21 35 day ) Do use intrauterine contraceptive device ( IUD ) take oral contraceptive pill Nulliparous Women mild dysmenorrhea ( pain low 4 numeric pain scale range 010 ) ; Women irregular infrequent menstrual cycle ( outside typical range cycle 21 35 day ) ; Women use intrauterine contraceptive device ( IUD ) take oral contraceptive pill . Women suffer disease diagnose added Women undergone surgical procedure treatment Provide skin lesion abdominal wall Use abuse drug alcohol Body mass index ( BMI ) > 15.99 kg/m2 ( maximum value underweight accord WHO ) < 25.00 kg m2 ( maximum overweight accord WHO )
